title: dimonstration
author: dimonstration
content: I just notice the icon as shown on screenshot below when I accidentally click the icon. I'm not aware that this icon is clickable until I accidentally click it now while browshing the forum thread.I just notice that if you will click the icon, It will display the thread that received a reply for today but I became confused on its real feature because it doesn't show some of the thread that received today post. FYI, The icon will gray out when you scan all the thread that has a today replies on the thread. Anyone using here this feature in the forum?

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Self-explanatory. When you hover the mouse over that icons, you see "New posts" and when you click, you will see all the threads that had a reply recently and you didn't read them yet. You can see this on the destination once click over the icon- "Recent Unread Topics"This is a great feature but I doubt many use this feature. I haven't use this feature ever if I can remember.

comments.author: Z_MBFM
comments.body: Quote from: dimonstration on August 10, 2023, 04:54:42 PM~snip~It's simple that when you click on a board name, you see all the topics there, but when you click on an icon to the left of the board name, you only see Recent Unread Topics The topics you read or visit remain in read mode until there are new posts by others on that topic after you visit. And the topics that you read will be hidden when you click on the icon and you won't see them. There is no other secret hidden there so don't be surprised because this topic may be new to you but many btt users already know about it.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Yes, the triangle icon is not known to everyone, but its function is very simple. It is intended to show unread topics in the section. When it is blue, this means that there are unread topics, and when it is gray, it means that there are no new unread topics in the section. Personally, I rarely use it.This triangle iconÂ  has been discussed before in the meta section about the possibility of converting it into another icon like bitcoin icon for example.

comments.author: Sexylizzy2813
comments.body: I have been in this Forum not up to a year and I haven't thought of clicking those icons, I was told that there are places I'm not suppose to visit or post and that thought stayed in my head till I got to this rank. Is really good to try out some things in this forum as long as you're not breaking the rules of this place. And I'd like to know if one can still post in any of those icons if you get it open?

Anyone using here this feature in the forum?It doesn't show threads that you already read (after visiting the thread) after having new replies, and that's the reason why it gray out, which means there's nothing for you to read on that particular board on that particular time.I usually didn't use it and i prefer using the Show unread posts since last visit.. Actually, it's more like the same but just in particular board.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Yes, I have tried to use that feature before (when I also realized it's clickable) to keep myself updated in the forum in case of new replies and comments, but I find out that not almost all topics that receive a new reply are indicated there. Sometimes, after reading a thread, I just add it to my watchlist, but any time I also check the watchlist, I only discover that some of the topics I added are not there. So, I don't use it again, but now I use the BTT Super notifier. I think if you are concerned that all the topics you are looking for are not on that icon, then you can use the BTT Super notifier to get updates on new mentions or comment notifications.

comments.body: It's not a new or mysterious feature, a similar post was made back in June and if you read through the replies, you will get a full understanding on what it is about.
